city: Veylcrest, called the Lapis Bastion, rises from a crescent bay where pale cliffs cradle streets paved in vapor-blue stone. The city core is fused to an ancient geode seam whose sapphire facets glimmer through archways and cellar vaults, giving Veylcrest its signature light without flame. Founders were exiled stonemasons and tide-readers who followed a sky-fallen sapphire into this bay three centuries ago; the shard was cut into lanterns that still burn in the Harbor Ward, and every civic oath is sealed under their blue glow. A silent cataclysm 143 years ago drew the sea away and hurled it back without sound, glassing the shore into rippled sheets and gouging an offshore whirlpool called the Blue Maw; since then, the city has treated the sea as both patron and debt-collector. Veylcrest prospers by refining lumen-sapphire into lenses, distilling azure glass, and outfitting tideborne caravels with aetheric lamps that make night sailing viable; in exchange, it depends on grain from the inland steppe terraces, timber from the Virenshade Canopy, iron from the Ironsung Pass, and freshwater captured by its whispering aqueduct. Power is braided rather than centralized: guild charters, temple compacts, and the Lantern Court of ward-delegates govern by negotiated edicts, while the Ledger bankers bind the decisions with contracts and collateral. Docks and terraces teem with sailors, quarry folk, water-mages of the Choir of Silt, masked financiers, and tinkers from the Artificers Hall; on festival nights, blue lamps wreathe the bay and the whole city hums with glass chimes tuned to the tide. Veylcrest is defensive without being dour; its citadel, the Sapphire Diadem, holds tide-horns that can shatter keels and ceremonial glaives that can shame dueling captains, and its watch relies on swift skiffs and rooftop signals more than walls. The city forbids outright worship of unbounded storms but honors the Tidemother through processions that bless ropes, sails, and wells, seeking balance between river silt and salt wealth. Tensions simmer over who owns the flow of water: the aqueduct has starved downstream orchards and fattened city cisterns, and the Choir of Silt pushes to loosen sluice-gates while merchants fear lean cargo seasons. Smugglers and night-traders operate in the caverns beneath Moonhook Docks, and their favorite currency is silence purchased from the Ledger at rates that would make a saint curse. Every child in Veylcrest learns the rule of three blue bells: one for rising fog, two for dead calm, three for the hush that comes before a soundless wave; no one wants to test whether the Silent Surge can come twice. Presently, a brittle pact keeps harbor guards, dockworkers, and sailors from open strikes, but a grain-short winter upstream and rumors of a cracked lens beneath the city threaten to splinter the braid of power. Travelers find a city equal parts prism and anchor, ready to buy cleverness and sell nerve, where the tide writes contracts in salt and glass.

surroundings.name: The Blue Maw
surroundings.terrain: Open sea with a persistent whirlpool ringed by glassy shoals
surroundings.description: A vast, soundless gyre birthed by the Silent Surge; waves slide into its throat without slapping and seabirds circle above without crying. At certain hours, sunlight spirals down the funnel and refracts into sapphire ribbons visible from the city roofs.
surroundings.history: Before the cataclysm, this was a deep anchorage. Divers sent by the Sapphire Diadem report a bowl of fused sand and an obsidian spike pulsing with cold.
legends: Some claim a titan heart beats at the Maw floor, and that it will wake if three bells ring in absolute silence.
Sailors swear you can cast a promise into the gyre and the sea will hold you to it; breaking such oaths invites a mute storm.
An ancient harbor chain once crossed this site; the links, ground to glass, still scrape hulls on moonless nights.
surroundings.resources: Rare driftglass, steady spin for experimental mills, deepwater fish that fetch high prices
factions_interest: Tidewardens patrol the rim to keep fool captains from proving bravery.
The Night Bazaar Syndicate runs skiffs that use the current to vanish from pursuit.
The Choir of Silt conducts hushed rites here to measure the sea pulse.
surroundings.risks: Sudden widening of the gyre, submerged glass ridges that shear keels, oppressive quiet that can panic crews
adventure_hooks: A Ledger courier went overboard clutching contracts sealed in wax that cannot get wet; the tide calendar says you have two hours before the Maw swallows them.
A metal song rises from the gyre with the next new moon; Artificers offer a vault-line of coin for whatever sings.

surroundings.name: Ironsung Pass
surroundings.terrain: Sheer granite cleft with iron-rich seams and echoing caverns
surroundings.description: The pass funnels wind into fluted caves that hum like hollow flutes; miners time their picks to the resonance to reduce rockfall.
surroundings.history: An old empire carved switchbacks here and inscribed marching measures to coordinate troop movements; now the measures help miners keep rhythm and stay safe.
legends: The mountain keeps the first war-song ever sung, and if sung backwards it will crumble the pass into slag.
A sleeping bronze wyrm coils around the deepest ore vein and wakes only for off-key notes.
surroundings.resources: High-grade iron ore, resonant stone used for tuning halls and tide-horns, bat guano for fertilizer
factions_interest: Guild of Azurites holds extraction rights through a precarious lease from the Lantern Court.
The Blue Fist dockworkers run pack lines to keep control of inland freight.
The Ledger keeps a silent partner who owns half the pulleys.
surroundings.risks: Echo amplification can stun, nocturnal rockfalls, pack-mule banditry by song-tuned raiders
adventure_hooks: A new shaft sings a note no one can match; miners who tried now speak only in whispers.
An avalanche reveals an imperial drum tower with scores etched on copper; decipher them to unlock a vault door.

surroundings.name: Virenshade Canopy
surroundings.distance: 1.5 days west by river barge and foot
surroundings.terrain: Dense mixed forest with phosphorescent moss and high platforms
surroundings.description: Ancient trees knit their crowns together, casting a green dusk at noon. Locals navigate on woven skyways above wolf and mushroom.
surroundings.history: Loggers once clear-cut swathes until the moss blighted their saws; now the city pays carefully managed harvests under Canopy Wardens.
legends: Moss remembers footsteps and leads the lost back to choices they regret.
A glass stag roams the high branches; its shed antlers cut through iron like reed.
Virenshade owls debate law and will escort you out if you argue your case well.
surroundings.resources: Slow-grown timber for hulls, resin for waterproofing, rare fungi used by alchemists
factions_interest: Artificers commission flexible mast-wood for their lighthouse designs.
The Serene Compact funds shrine groves to keep the Wardens friendly.
The Night Bazaar seeks stag antlers rumored to pierce locks silently.
surroundings.risks: Spore fogs that dull memory, branch-slides, canopy raiders with glider capes
adventure_hooks: A Warden asks for discreet help: a blue-lamp burns in the deep shade, implying poachers with city tech.
The forest refuses to release a shipment; every path loops back to the start unless a secret debt is repaid.

surroundings.name: Shattermere
surroundings.terrain: Salt lake with mirror-flat plates of glass and black brine pools
surroundings.description: A low basin where the Silent Surge vitrified the mudflats. The wind plays harp-lines across shattered panes; the brine between plates is bottomless and cold.
surroundings.history: The founders tested their first lumen-lenses here and cracked half the lake; the shards are now traded as augury tiles.
legends: If you lay the right seven tiles you can glimpse a future tide; laying the wrong seven brings a past debt to collect you.
A faceless pilgrim counts broken panes at dusk; if you interrupt the count, your name loses its echo.
surroundings.resources: Clinker glass, salt crusts, augury shards prized by gamblers and navigators
factions_interest: Ledger agents buy up omen-sets to fix prices on luck.
The Lantern Court stages oath-ceremonies on the safest plate every fifth year.
Choir of Silt maps currents beneath the plates to read river-sea tensions.
surroundings.risks: Sudden plate shift, brine geysers, light mirages that mislead travelers
adventure_hooks: A perfect uncracked pane revealed at low wind has inscriptions beneath the surface; it will sink at dusk.
A gambler lost a chartered wharf to a bad draw and hires you to prove the omen-tiles were salted.

surroundings.name: Sunken Steppe Terraces
surroundings.terrain: Flooded agricultural terraces and half-drowned stair-villages
surroundings.description: Stone steps climb a wide valley, each terrace a patchwork of reeds, millet, and reedboats moored to stair shrines. When the river swells, lower steps vanish and bells ring underwater.
surroundings.history: The terraces were engineered by an older culture that worshiped river timing. Veylcrest aqueducts altered flow and drowned ancestral granaries; the steppers still sell grain to the city but at salted terms.
legends: When the bells all sound in unison, the River Judge rises to weigh a citys water theft.
A library of waterproof scrolls drifts under the seventh terrace, readable only by those who can hold their breath like a heron.
surroundings.resources: Grain, reeds for mats and boat-hulls, river pearls
factions_interest: The Choir of Silt agitates to re-balance gates and pays stipends to terrace bell-ringers.
Ledger operatives hold debts on upstream mills.
Blue Fist muscle rides barges to secure quotas.
surroundings.risks: Flash-floods, submerged stair-slime, terrace feuds spilling into river ambushes
adventure_hooks: A bell-string is cut the night before a weigh-festival; someone wants the Judge to stay asleep.
Millet shipments rot in transit; saboteurs are seeding alchemical molds.

surroundings.name: Emberfield Kilns
surroundings.distance: Two days south over basalt flats
surroundings.terrain: Basalt knolls riddled with geothermal vents and ash meadows
surroundings.description: Natural chimneys exhale steady heat that Veylcrest glasswrights harness with clay bells and wind-sails to achieve azure-glass clarity.
surroundings.history: A caravan of glasswrights settled here a century ago under a deal with the Lantern Court, paying a tithe in panes and accepting Tidewarden oversight after a vent explosion darkened half the bay.
legends: A fire sprite married a glasswright and still polishes panes by moonlight; she cracks any glass used to spy on lovers.
There is a flute made of cooled vent-wind that can stop the Blue Maw for one breath.
surroundings.resources: Even heat for glassmaking, pumice, fire-resistant clays
factions_interest: Artificers test new lens forms and rumor speaks of a city-sized focusing array.
Night Bazaar mules move unsanctioned panes at dusk.
Ledger auditors keep counting cords of fuel that never arrive.
surroundings.risks: Vent surges, glass storms when kilns shatter, ash lung
adventure_hooks: A kiln chorus has fallen silent, which should be impossible; workers refuse to enter until a blessing is performed.
A pane etched with tide-runic script shows the city crackling with blue fractures next winter.

surroundings.name: The Elder Chain Shoals
surroundings.distance: Half-day by fast sloop along the coast
surroundings.terrain: Jagged reefs studded with corroded iron rings and half-buried anchors
surroundings.description: Remnants of an ancient harbor chain litter a maze of coral and rust. At low tide the rings rise like teeth; at high tide their pull tangles nets and ankles alike.
surroundings.history: The chain once barred invaders in the empire age and was later cut to free trade. Chunks were hauled to Veylcrest to forge tide-horns and ceremonial glaives.
legends: If you thread three rings in order, a gate opens to a sleeping harbor where storms never reach.
The chain remembers commanders names; speak one and the sea answers with that captains last command.
surroundings.resources: Storm-hardened coral, salvaged metals, barnacle-crusted curios
factions_interest: Tidewardens train here to learn ring-currents.
Syndicate divers stage black-market auctions in a flooded cistern.
Serene Compact pilgrims collect rust to seed protective patinas on city icons.
adventure_hooks: A lost ring branded with forbidden sigils surfaces after an earthquake; it hums when near the Sapphire Diadem.
A sloop runs aground with its captain lashed to the mast, jaw locked as if following a command no one else can hear.

buildings.name: The Sapphire Diadem
buildings.location: Central ridge above the Harbor Ward
buildings.description: A crown of fused sapphire and stone with ramparts that glitter even in moonless dark. Tide-horns line a terrace facing the bay; their resonant blasts shake hulls and settle arguments.
buildings.history: Built around the first meteor shard; expanded after the Silent Surge to house the Lantern Court chambers and the citys blue oath-lanterns.
legends: A secret keep lies under the Diadem, hollowed directly into the geode; its ceilings drip with condensed light.
The Diadem cracks a hairline each time a city law is made in bad faith; the crack is said to be spreading.
factions_control: Lantern Court holds chambers within.
Tidewardens maintain a garrison and horn crews.
Ledger keeps vault-suites in a secure wing.
buildings.dependencies: Relies on Artificers for lens upkeep and on Choir of Silt for tide-horn tuning water
buildings.secrets: A locked gallery of broken lenses hums on windless nights as if catching a light that is not there.

buildings.name: Aethral Archive
buildings.location: Scholars Ward near the aqueduct arches
buildings.description: Stacked galleries of blue-tinted glass, each shelf shadowed by lenses that shift text clarity to match a readers breath. The vault holds tide charts, glass grimoires, and reed-scrolls sealed in wax.
buildings.history: Founded by a syndicate of readers who bartered debt forgiveness for public access, later patronized by the Serene Compact.
legends: There is a book that no eye can read directly; you must study its shadow.
A missing map shows the citys reflections, not its streets; walking it takes you to places doors will not.
factions_control: Serene Compact curates doctrine shelves.
Artificers use a wing for test scripts.
Ledger locks a contract scriptorium in the basement.
buildings.dependencies: Imports reed-scrolls from the Sunken Steppe, inks distilled at Emberfield
buildings.secrets: A scholar transcribed the silence of the Blue Maw and bound it between panes; opening it kills all sound nearby.

buildings.name: Moonhook Docks
buildings.location: Lower curve of the crescent bay
buildings.description: Timber piers hooked like sickles into the tide, with lantern-posts that descend on chains to wash light through hulls. Below, caverns honeycomb the cliff, housing cold-cellars, shrine niches, and smugglers routes.
buildings.history: Extended in layered eras; the lowest piers predate the city and anchor to stone rings similar to those at the Elder Chain Shoals.
legends: If a lantern is lowered while a liar speaks, the light will not touch him.
The deepest cavern holds a door that opens only for debts forgiven freely.
factions_control: Blue Fist runs stevedore crews and hires out muscle.
Tidewardens command harbor patrols from a tower here.
Night Bazaar Syndicate operates hidden markets below the third pier.
buildings.dependencies: Freshwater channels from the Whispering Aqueduct, constant lens repairs
buildings.secrets: A retiree Tidewarden keeps a ledger of bribes that could topple half the Court.

buildings.name: Whispering Aqueduct
buildings.location: Arches from Sunken Steppe intake to city cisterns
buildings.description: A spine of pale stone standing on rune-cut piers; water voices echo in the conduits, warning of pressure and impurity to those who can listen. Sluice-gates hang with bells that ring when opened too far.
buildings.history: Raised in stages by bond-issues brokered by the Ledger; the final leg was rushed after a drought, causing legal knots in ownership along the flow.
legends: A mason traded his shadow to finish the keystone; the aqueduct has no shadow at noon wherever it runs.
If the right three bells ring together, the river will walk into the city on dry feet.
factions_control: Ledger claims majority right-of-flow through complex charters.
Choir of Silt maintains ritual balance and affixes silt-traps.
Lantern Court coordinates work crews for maintenance.
buildings.dependencies: Dependent on upstream goodwill; guarded by Tidewardens during unrest
buildings.secrets: Hidden bleed-valves funnel water to Syndicate cisterns in exchange for silence during strikes.

buildings.name: Temple of the Tidemother
buildings.location: Harbor Ward facing the open bay
buildings.description: A colonnade of sea-worn stone enclosing a tide altar that floods on schedule. Petitioners speak into conch niches; priests answer only at slack water, claiming the sea carries words better then.
buildings.history: Built on a pre-city shrine of fisher clans; expanded after the Silent Surge with civic funds after rising from the flood unscathed.
legends: The altar drinks false offerings and spits them as brine fish that cannot be cooked.
A hidden stair in the font leads to a salt library of oaths frozen into crystals.
factions_control: Serene Compact leads rites and mediates disputes.
Tidewardens swear their posts here.
Azulite miners beg for safe stone seams in lean years.
buildings.dependencies: Needs clean flow from aqueduct to mix with seawater for balance rituals
buildings.secrets: A senior priestess is quietly negotiating with terrace bell-ringers to stage a public weighing of the city.

buildings.name: Hall of Subtle Artifice
buildings.description: Cluttered courts ringed by glass-roofed studios. Copper arms hoist great lenses; wind-harps hum test tones to tune aetheric lamps and tide-horns.
buildings.history: Formed from rival tinkers forced to share space after a fire. Their stitched charter is a masterpiece of compromise and loophole.
legends: An apprentice built a lamp that burns truths into walls; it has been hidden since a Magistrates door turned black.
The hall clock runs on a captured gust from the Silent Surge and refuses to chime when a project will fail.
factions_control: Artificers Council elects masters by demonstration.
Ledger underwrites dangerous projects for future percentages.
Night Bazaar buys prototypes off-books.
buildings.dependencies: Kiln heat from Emberfield, timber spars from Virenshade
buildings.secrets: A scale model of a citywide focusing ring exists under tarps; it would turn every blue lamp toward one point.

buildings.name: The Night Bazaar of Brass
buildings.location: Between Moonhook Docks and the old salt quarter
buildings.description: Winding alleys lit by pierced brass lanterns that throw patterned shadows. Vendors hawk hush-ink, debt-keys, storm-snails, and glass charms that deflect gossip.
buildings.history: Sanctioned unofficially to keep contraband in one predictable maze. Brass lamps are tuned to dim when patrol boots approach.
legends: A stall appears only when you are owed a favor; it sells the precise tool to collect.
The bazaar keeps a ledger of names traded as coin; reading it erases your own from the city registers.
factions_control: Night Bazaar Syndicate maintains order and collects shadow-tithes.
Blue Fist guards muscle the gates on festival nights.
Ledger spies purchase silence and future options.
buildings.dependencies: Feeds on surplus and shortfall across all guilds
buildings.secrets: A hidden court arbitrates smuggling disputes with blindfolds and ringing bowls; its rulings are enforced by everyone and no one.

buildings.name: The Glassward Infirmary
buildings.location: Edge of Scholars Ward near Shattermere road
buildings.description: A crescent of pale wards with skylights that filter sun through blue panes to calm fevers. Healing chimes hang over every bed; the tones are tuned to pulse rates.
buildings.history: Founded after the Silent Surge to treat glass-lung and quiet-panic. Expanded as trade brought new ailments and poisons.
legends: A bed in the east ward cures any injury but grants the sea a single future pain to collect.
If the chimes are all stilled at noon, a forgotten patient will speak.
factions_control: Serene Compact staffs healers.
Ledger funds research in exchange for proprietary tonics.
Artificers test glass prosthetics.
buildings.dependencies: Herbs from Virenshade, salts from Shattermere, silt poultices from the Choir
buildings.secrets: Records of a failed vaccine against ash lung show altered dates; someone is hiding a lab accident linked to Emberfield.

politics.name: Lantern Court
politics.influence: High in lawmaking and arbitration; moderate on the streets without guild muscle
goals: Maintain balance among water, trade, and craft without sparking strikes or famine
Resolve aqueduct charter disputes before terrace uprisings spread
Keep foreign navies from testing the bays soundless reputation
assets: Deliberation chambers in the Sapphire Diadem
A bell-code network across rooftops
Oath-lanterns that bind procedural promises
leaders: Speaker Nhal Vessin, a former shipwright who counts votes like rivets
Bell-Marshal Arla Third-Tone, master of the signal codes
rivals: Ledger for overreach via debt instruments
Night Bazaar Syndicate for undermining edicts
politics.methods: Edicts by consensus braid, public hearings timed to tides, symbolic fines paid in salt
politics.tensions: Delegates from the Harbor Ward threaten walkout if aqueduct flows are cut; inland wards threaten the reverse
politics.hidden_agenda: A slim majority is considering relocating oath-lanterns away from the Diadem to dilute Ledger leverage

politics.name: Guild of Azurites
politics.influence: High over stone supply and lumen-sapphire refinement
goals: Secure perpetual rights at Ironsung and new veins beneath the city
Shift taxes from weight to finished value
Acquire Tidewarden exemption for heavy loads during night curfew
assets: Blast crews who can shape stone like wood
Exclusive lens-grit polishing mills
Labor lodges that double as strike musters
leaders: Guildmaster Sera Flintline, who never removes her dust-veil
Foreman Kold Jasp, a negotiator with a cracked smile
allies: Blue Fist for freight and picket lines
rivals: Ledger for collateral seizures in lean years
Choir of Silt for opposing deep pumps beneath the aquifer
politics.methods: Work stoppages that halt city lighting, price fixing on cut stone, black-sand funds to buy votes
politics.tensions: A rumored underbay seam could flood half their tunnels; Choir insists the seam sings wrong
politics.hidden_agenda: Keeping a secret shaft under the Diadem to leverage any law that harms their quotas

politics.name: Tidewardens
politics.influence: High on the water, moderate in chambers
goals: Prevent another Silent Surge panic by controlling rumors and bells
Standardize lighthouse lenses for unified signaling
Crush Syndicate smuggling without sparking a dock war
assets: Fast skiffs and a horn-barge capable of cracking hulls
Legal right to seize cargo under hush statutes
Training grounds at the Elder Chain Shoals
leaders: Commodore Jath Pell, tide-stern and tired
Signal-Captain Miren Nine-Ropes, tactician of knots and codes
rivals: Night Bazaar Syndicate over cavern routes
Blue Fist when curfews cut wages
politics.methods: Night patrols, surprise horn drills, cordon-and-signal operations
politics.tensions: Crew pay lags privateer rates; desertions creep upward
politics.hidden_agenda: Maintain a sealed archive of bribes to deploy only if the Court fractures

politics.name: The Ledgers Veil
politics.influence: Very high through debt webs and silence-purchase
goals: Enforce water-rights charters that keep aqueduct collateral under their thumb
Monetize silence and reputation as tradable futures
Expand into upstream mills to own the grain before it is grain
assets: Vault-suites inside the Diadem
Silent clerks trained to remember full contracts without ink
A private bell-code that alters market hours
leaders: First Mask Orven, a voice heard but face never seen
Bond-Mother Reza, who sets hush rates
allies: Night Bazaar for gray-market liquidity when it suits them
rivals: Choir of Silt on water commons
politics.methods: Collateral seizures disguised as restructures, buying and selling gossip rights, sponsoring festivals to launder goodwill
politics.tensions: Public anger at terrace drownings snarls their water paper; masked clerks harassed in alleys
politics.hidden_agenda: A contingency to sell the citys oath-lanterns abroad if a panic cracks the Diadem

politics.name: The Choir of Silt
politics.kind: Water-mages, river adjudicators, and agrarian advocates
politics.influence: Moderate but rising due to drought anxieties
goals: Rebalance aqueduct gates seasonally to feed terraces and refill wetlands
Sanctify a city rite acknowledging upstream debts
Install silt-traps that also trap corruption by ringing when bribes are taken
assets: Bell-ringers in terrace villages
Silt-sense rituals that read water memory
Shrine networks along river and in city wells
leaders: Delta-Keeper Ys Hul, speaking in the river plural
Novice Rae Fen, a former dockhand who hears pipes hum
allies: Some Lantern Court delegates from inland wards
rivals: Azurites over deep pumps and subsidence
politics.methods: Processions that halt traffic until sluice-bells ring, water-divination testimonies in chambers, blessing or boycotting wells
politics.tensions: Seen as anti-city by harbor folk who fear low cisterns for ships and baths
politics.hidden_agenda: A ritual to still the Blue Maw briefly to prove the river and sea can be reconciled

politics.name: Blue Fist
politics.influence: High on the waterfront, low in the stacks
goals: Secure wage floors tied to tide cycles rather than Court whims
Control inland freight lines to Ironsung and Steppe
Install Blue Fist safety captains on every pier
assets: Picket crews that can stop the citys breath in an hour
Wharfside bunkhouses doubling as soup halls
Signal drums faster than bells in fog
leaders: Boss Kema Hookhand, a negotiator who breaks chains on stage
Old Jori Nets, patron of orphans and informants
politics.methods: Threat of general strike, shadow tariffs, escorting sensitive cargoes for a cut
politics.tensions: Internal split between hardliners ready to torch Pier Three and moderates feeding families
politics.hidden_agenda: A buried war chest in a sealed cavern keyed to a drum pattern only Kema knows

politics.name: Night Bazaar Syndicate
politics.influence: Variable; strongest in fog and famine
goals: Keep cavern routes beneath Moonhook viable and deniable
Expand hush-ink trade that un-writes ledgers for a night
Broker peace between crews to avoid costly flare-ups
assets: Cavern maps that change with the tide
Brass lampwrights who tune dim and bright to signal deals
Assassins who only cut knots, not throats, by reputation
leaders: Mist-Matron Sall, who never speaks above a whisper
The Brass Twins, lantern-bearers and rumor-keepers
allies: Certain Ledger masks who enjoy gray dividends
politics.methods: Shadow-tithes, rumor futures, blind auctions in flooded cisterns
politics.tensions: A new vigilante in brass has been breaking lamp-codes; may be an Artificer or Tidewarden plant
politics.hidden_agenda: Acquire an oath-lantern shard to compel promises in the dark

politics.name: Serene Compact
politics.influence: High in hearts, middling in coin
goals: Maintain rites that keep panic from hollowing the city
Expand charity at the Glassward Infirmary without Ledger strings
Broker a formal accord between river and sea cults
assets: Temple of the Tidemother and satellite shrines
Processional rights that can stop fights in the street
Chaplains embedded with guards and guilds
leaders: High Acolyte Shunn of the Ripple
allies: Choir of Silt for water ethics
rivals: Night Bazaar for sacrilege in oath-trading
politics.methods: Public blessings, fasting to draw attention, sanctifying oaths with blue-light
politics.tensions: Accused of hoarding donations; actually safeguarding emergency grain
politics.hidden_agenda: A secret pact with terrace bell-ringers to force a citywide day of stillness if violence looms

politics.name: Hall of Subtle Artifice Council
goals: Complete a unified lens standard
Prove a citywide focusing ring is safe and necessary
Win independent charter status from the Court and Ledger alike
assets: Prototype lamps and tide-horns
Guild apprentices loyal to innovation over coin
Secured workshops with alarm chimes
leaders: Mistress Kelen Prism, champion of the focusing ring
allies: Serene Compact when projects serve the public
rivals: Tidewardens for operational control of signals
politics.methods: Demonstrations on public piers, white papers in the Archive, patronage of promising street tinkerers
politics.tensions: Internal schism between bold ring-builders and safe incrementalists
politics.hidden_agenda: Hidden prototype mounted beneath the Diadem that could blind the Blue Maw or blind the city
